Package bio.singa.mathematics.vectors

Class Scalar

  • java.lang.Object
    • bio.singa.mathematics.vectors.Scalar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Addable<Vector>, AdditivelyInvertible<Vector>, Divisible<Vector>, Invertible<Vector>, MultiDimensional<Vector>, Multipliable<Vector>, Ring<Vector>, Subtractable<Vector>, Metrizable<Vector>, Transformable<Vector>, Vector
    public class Scalar
extends java.lang.Object
implements Vector
    This class is a wrapper class for one dimensional vectors that may be used instead of double values to avoid mixing of different levels of abstraction.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Scalar​(double value)
      Creates a new scalar with the given value.

      • getElement

        public double getElement​(int index)
        Returns the value of this vector.

        This method exists solely for compatibility to the vector interface. If you want to get the value of this scalar it is better to use the getValue() Method.

        Specified by:
        getElement in interface Vector
        Parameters:
        index - The index, to get the value from.
        Returns:
        A single element of this vector at the given position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is different from 0

        public Scalar subtract​(Vector subtrahend)
        Description copied from interface: Subtractable
        Subtracts the given Object (called subtrahend) from this Object (called minuend) and returns a new Object (called difference). Neither subtrahend nor minuend shall be changed.
        Specified by:
        subtract in interface Subtractable<Vector>
        Parameters:
        subtrahend - Another object.
        Returns:

      • multiply

        public Scalar multiply​(double scalar)
        Description copied from interface: Vector
        The scalar multiplication is an algebraic operation that returns a new vector where each element is multiplied by the given scalar. This operation can also be thought of as "stretching" of the vector.
        Specified by:
        multiply in interface Vector
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar.
        Returns:
        The scalar multiplication.

      • dyadicProduct

        public RegularMatrix dyadicProduct​(Vector vector)
        Description copied from interface: Vector
        The numerical components of vectors can be arranged into row and column vectors. The dyadic product returns a matrix, where the element (i,j) is obtained by multiplying the i'th element of this vector with the j'th element of the other vector.
        Specified by:
        dyadicProduct in interface Vector
        Parameters:
        vector - Another vector of the same dimension.
        Returns:
        The matrix of the dyadic product

      • distanceTo

        public double distanceTo​(Vector another)
        This method calculates the Eucledian distance between this vector and the given vector.

        The Euclidean distance for one dimension is the absolute difference between their values.

        Specified by:
        distanceTo in interface Metrizable<Vector>
        Specified by:
        distanceTo in interface Vector
        Parameters:
        another - Another 1D vector.
        Returns:
        The Euclidean distance.
        Throws:
        IncompatibleDimensionsException - if this vector has more than one dimension.
        See Also:
        MinkowskiMetric
